t: Send*pn the tribute*i lamb to the ruler of the land, From*ln Sela by way of the wilderness to the mountain of the daughter of Zion.
Then,*ln like fleeing birds or*i scattered nestlings, The*ln daughters of Moab will be at the fords of the Arnon.
“Give*ln us*i advice, make a decision; Cast*ln your shadow like night at high noon; Hide*ln the outcasts, do not betray the fugitive.

Let*ln the outcasts of Moab stay with you; Be*ln a hiding place to them from the destroyer.” For*ln the extortioner has come to an end, destruction has ceased, Oppressors*ln have completely disappeared*i from the land.
A*ln throne will even be established in lovingkindness, And*ln a judge will sit on it in faithfulness in the tent of David; Moreover,*ln he will seek justice And*ln be prompt in righteousness.
We*ln have heard of the pride of Moab, an excessive pride; Even*iln of his arrogance, pride, and fury; His*ln idle boasts are false.
Therefore*ln Moab will wail; everyone of Moab will wail. You*ln will moan for the raisin cakes of Kir-hareseth As*ln those who are utterly stricken.

For*ln the fields of Heshbon have withered, the vines of Sibmah as*i well;*i The*ln lords of the nations have trampled down its choice clusters Which*ln reached as far as Jazer and*i wandered to the deserts; Its*ln tendrils spread themselves out and*i passed over the sea.

Therefore*ln I will weep bitterly for Jazer, for the vine of Sibmah; I*ln will drench you with my tears, O Heshbon and Elealeh; For*ln the shouting over your summer fruits and your harvest has fallen away.

Gladness*ln and joy are taken away from the fruitful field; In*ln the vineyards also there will be no cries of joy or jubilant shouting, No*ln treader treads out wine in the presses, For*iln I have made the shouting to cease.
Therefore*ln my heart intones like a harp for Moab And*ln my inward feelings for Kir-hareseth.
So*ln it will come about when Moab presents himself, When*ln he wearies himself upon his*i high place And*ln comes to his sanctuary to pray, That*ln he will not prevail.
This*p is the word which the Lord*s spoke earlier concerning Moab.

But now the Lord*s speaks, saying, “Within three years, as a hired man would count them, the glory of Moab will be degraded along with all his*i great population, and his*i remnant will be very small and*i impotent.”
